findings.title: Improper Logic In SLDBroker::calcBrokerAmount()
findings.description: The `calcBrokerAmount()` function mistakenly uses the entire trading volume as the reward without taking into account the proper level-specific `RewardNumerator`, resulting in current brokers at the ranking level B receiving more rewards than expected, at the potential loss of other protocol brokers!

findings.title: Implicit Assumption Of Shared Decimals Among Stable Coins
findings.description: The implicit assumption of sharing the same decimals among the supported stable coins may need to strictly enforced, which is currently missing.

findings.title: Declaration of Variable with Unnecessarily Wide Scope
findings.description: Declaring a variable with unnecessarily wide scope can lead to unintended consequences and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
findings.description: The initial value of `_푧_` to the iteration was given as `_푧_ = ( _푥_ + 1)∕2`, which results in an integer overflow when `_푥_` equals `uint256(-1)`. This essentially sets `_푧_` to zero, leading to a division by zero in the calculation of `_푧_ = ( _푥_ ∕ _푧_ + _푧_ )∕2`.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the Shield protocol, there is a special administrative account, i.e., owner . This owner account plays a critical role in governing and regulating the system-wide operations.

findings.title: Use of a Non-reentrant Function in a Concurrent Context
findings.description: The deposit() function in SLDOption contract violates the checks-effects-interactions principle, making it vulnerable to re-entrancy attacks.

findings.title: Improper Enforcement of Behavioral Workflow
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to unexpected behaviors from code that an application uses.

findings.title: Bad Coding Practices
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to coding practices that are deemed unsafe and increase the chances that an exploitable vulnerability will be present in the application.

findings.title: Business Logic Errors
findings.description: Errors in business logic can be devastating to an entire application.
